publications.title: Human rights violations escalate in Venezuela following disputed presidential election
publications.abstract: The Mission’s findings reveal a coordinated effort to target perceived political opponents. Abuses “were committed as part of a coordinated plan to silence, discourage and quash opposition to the . Findings are drawn from open-access material and should be reviewed directly in the source publication page for full methodology. This item is included in the 2024-2026 deep-dive window and can be downloaded at no cost from the news.un.org publication page.

publications.title: Venezuela and the Struggle Between Autocracy and Democracy
publications.abstract: In a new series of policy briefs, the “Venezuela Desk,” the Wilson Center’s Latin America Program examines Venezuela’s flawed July 28 presidential election, the government’s response to post-election . The publication synthesizes evidence intended to support planning decisions in the Venezuelan operating environment as of 2024. Findings are drawn from open-access material and should be reviewed directly in the source publication page for full methodology. This item is included in the 2024-2026 deep-dive window and can be downloaded at no cost from the www.wilsoncenter.org publication page.
